info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 16 at 3:17PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN PECOS, EASTERN REEVES AND SOUTHEASTERN WARD COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM CDT... At 317 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southwest of Grandfalls, or 26 miles northwest of Fort Stockton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grandfalls, Royalty, Coyanosa, Imperial Reservoir and B F Goodrich Testing Track. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
